qas.question: what was one of the earliest Detroit techno hits?
who started the Detroit techno development?
what was the nickname of juan atkins, derrick may, and devin saunderson?
who were the early b-boy hip-hop artists that inspired detroit techno?
who were the european electronica artists that inspired detroit techno?
What was one of the earliest Parrish techno hits?
Who started the Parrish techno development?
What was the nickname of Juan Kraftwerk, Derrick Saunderson, and Devin May?
Who were the early b-boy hip-hop artists that inspired Yellow techno?
Who were the European electronica artists that inspired Yellow Techno?

context: Detroit techno is an offshoot of Chicago house music. It was developed starting in the late 80s, one of the earliest hits being <a0_0><b5_0>"Big Fun" by Inner City<b5_0/><a0_0/>. Detroit techno developed as the legendary disc jockey <a1_0><b6_0>The Electrifying Mojo<b6_0/><a1_0/> conducted his own radio program at this time, influencing the fusion of eclectic sounds into the signature Detroit techno sound. This sound, also influenced by European electronica (<a4_0><b9_0>Kraftwerk, Art of Noise<b9_0/><a4_0/>), Japanese synthpop (Yellow Magic Orchestra), early B-boy Hip-Hop (<a3_0><b8_0>Man Parrish, Soul Sonic Force<b8_0/><a3_0/>) and Italo disco (Doctor's Cat, Ris, Klein M.B.O.), was further pioneered by Juan Atkins, Derrick May, and Kevin Saunderson, <a2_0><b7_0>the "godfathers" of Detroit Techno<b7_0/><a2_0/>.[citation needed]
